title: RS21293
content: A terrorist nuclear attack on a U.S. seaport could cause local devastationand affect the global economy. Terrorists might obtain a bomb in several ways, though each poses difficulties. Ability to detect a bomb appears limited. The United States is using technology, intelligence, internationalcooperation, etc., to try to thwart an attack. Issues for Congress include safeguarding foreign nuclear material,mitigating economic effects of an attack, and allocating funds between ports and other potential targets. This reportwill be updated as needed.
